questions.text: What is the recommended approach regarding accessories during trekking?

options.b: Keep accessories that are easy to carry

questions.explanation: During travel, keep accessories which are easy to carry and may add grace to your overall look, rather than carrying too many or avoiding them completely.

questions.text: What medical precaution is recommended before heading for trekking?
questions.explanation: While planning your trekking trip, it is preferable to have a medical fitness check up done to ensure you are fit and fine before heading for trekking.

questions.text: Which of these diseases are mentioned for taking medical precautions before trekking?
questions.explanation: It is essential to have medical precautions against diseases like malaria, cholera, tetanus, typhoid and hepatitis before going for trekking.

questions.text: What should you do if suffering from previous ailments before trekking?

options.a: Ignore and hope for the best

questions.explanation: If suffering from any kind of ailment, do carry proper prescribed medicines to prevent serious health problems during trekking.

questions.text: What type of shoes are recommended for trekking?
questions.explanation: Always wear proper trekking shoes while trekking as uncomfortable shoes can hurt your feet and lead to serious foot injuries.

questions.text: Why is it important to spend time arranging proper trekking shoes?
questions.explanation: Uncomfortable pair of shoes can harshly hurt your feet and can lead to serious foot injuries while trekking, hence proper shoes are essential.

questions.text: What size of trekking shoes is recommended compared to regular shoes?
questions.explanation: Choose trekking shoes that are a half-size bigger than your regular shoes to allow space for swelling caused while trekking and to hold heavier trekking socks.

questions.text: Why should trekking shoes be half-size bigger than regular shoes?
questions.explanation: Half-size bigger shoes allow space for swelling caused while trekking and provide room for heavier trekking socks.

questions.text: What type of food items are recommended to carry during trekking?
questions.explanation: Do carry food items which carry larger amount of carbohydrates as they provide sustained energy during trekking.

questions.text: What essential medical item must always be carried during trekking?

options.b: First aid box and important medicines

questions.explanation: Always take important medicine and first aid box with you to handle any medical emergencies during trekking.

questions.text: Which body part needs special protection in frequently changing weather?
questions.explanation: Always cover your neck area, particularly in frequently changing weather as it can lead to serious neck problems and pains if left uncovered.

questions.text: What can happen if the neck is left uncovered during trekking?
questions.explanation: The neck area can lead to serious neck problems and pains if left uncovered, especially in frequently changing weather conditions.

questions.text: What type of socks are recommended for trekking?
questions.explanation: Do wear thick woolen socks or stockings while trekking for better comfort and protection.

questions.text: What is the advantage of synthetic blended socks for trekking?
questions.explanation: Synthetic blended socks are specially designed to preclude feet moisture, making them ideal for trekking purposes.

questions.text: What health problems should prescribed medicines prevent during trekking?
questions.explanation: Carry proper prescribed medicines to prevent serious health problems including heatstroke, severe headache, cough, dehydration and hypothermia.

questions.text: Why is medical fitness check up considered 'most essential' before trekking?

options.b: To be fit and fine before heading

questions.explanation: It is most essential to be fit and fine before heading for trekking, hence medical fitness check up is crucial.

questions.text: What is the consequence of wearing uncomfortable shoes during trekking?
questions.explanation: Uncomfortable shoes can harshly hurt your feet and can lead to serious foot injuries while trekking.

questions.text: What additional purpose do half-size bigger shoes serve besides accommodating swelling?
questions.explanation: Half-size bigger shoes allow space for swelling and also provide room to hold heavier trekking socks comfortably.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT mentioned as a health problem to prevent with medicines?
questions.explanation: The mentioned health problems to prevent include heatstroke, severe headache, cough, dehydration and hypothermia, but not diabetes specifically.

questions.text: What is the primary reason for carrying carbohydrate-rich food during trekking?
questions.explanation: Carbohydrate-rich food provides sustained energy needed for the physical exertion during trekking.

questions.text: Why are synthetic blended socks specifically recommended for trekking?
questions.explanation: Synthetic blended socks are specially designed to preclude feet moisture, which is crucial for comfort and preventing blisters during trekking.

questions.text: What should be the approach towards accessories during trekking travel?
questions.explanation: Accessories should be easy to carry and add grace to your overall look, suggesting a minimal and practical approach.

questions.text: What is the relationship between trekking shoes and trekking socks?
questions.explanation: Trekking shoes need to be half-size bigger to accommodate both foot swelling and heavier trekking socks comfortably.

questions.text: What weather condition specifically requires neck protection?
questions.explanation: The neck area particularly needs protection in frequently changing weather conditions to prevent serious neck problems.

questions.text: What is the overall theme of these trekking guidelines?
questions.explanation: All guidelines focus on prevention of problems and proper preparation to ensure a safe and trouble-free trekking experience.
